recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the SSL 2.0 protocol is supported
Evaluates whether the SSL 3.0 protocol is supported
Evaluates whether the TLS 1.0 protocol is supported
Evaluates whether the TLS 1.1 protocol is supported
Evaluates whether the TLS 1.2 protocol is supported
Evaluates whether the TLS 1.3 protocol is supported
Evaluates whether a TLS 1.3 version draft is supported

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Update your server and enable the TLS 1.3 final version

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the DTLS 1.0 protocol is supported

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Disable DTLS 1.0, it is a UDP protocol

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the DTLS 1.2 protocol is supported

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Disable DTLS 1.2, it is a UDP protocol

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the DTLS 1.3 protocol is supported

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Disable DTLS 1.3, it is a UDP protocol

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports null ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Fortezza ciphers

resultingRecommendation.detailedDescription: Fortezza cipher suittes were developed by NSA in the 90s. You should better get rid of Fortezza algorithms.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports export ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports anonymous ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports DES ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports 3DES (Triple DES) ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports SEED ciphers
recommendation.detailedDescription: SEED is a 128 bit block cipher developed by the KISA (Korea Information Security Agency) in 1998

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports IDEA ciphers
recommendation.detailedDescription: IDEA (International Data Encryption Algorithm) is a block cipher. It uses a 128 bit key and operates on 64 bit blocks.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports RC2 ciphers
recommendation.detailedDescription: RC2 is a 64 bit block cipher designed by Ron Rivest in 1987

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports RC4 ciphers
recommendation.detailedDescription: RC4 is a stream cipher designed by Ron Rivest in 1987

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports CBC cipher suites
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports AEAD (Authenticated Encryption with Associated Data) cipher suites, e.g., AES-GCM

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Enable AEAD cipher suites, e.g., AES-GCM

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS)

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Enable perfect forward secure cipher suites, e.g., TLS-DHE or TLS-ECDHE

recommendation.shortName: Support for only PFS cipher suites
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server exclusively supports Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS)

resultingRecommendation.shortDescription: Not all cipher suites are perfect forward secure
resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Consider disabling cipher suites which are not perfect forward secure. Enable only perfect forward secure cipher suites, e.g., TLS-DHE or TLS-ECDHE

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports AES cipher
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Camellia cipher
recommendation.detailedDescription: Camellia is a 128 bit block cipher designed by Mitsubishi and NTT in 2000

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports ARIA cipher
recommendation.detailedDescription: ARIA is a 128 bit block cipher designed in 2003

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports ChaCha cipher
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports RSA key exchange
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Diffie-Hellman (DH) key exchange

recommendation.shortName: Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange support
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange

resultingRecommendation.shortDescription: Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange is disabled

recommendation.shortName: Static Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange support
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports static Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange

resultingRecommendation.shortDescription: Static Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchange is enabled

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports GOST cipher
recommendation.detailedDescription: GOST is a block cipher designed in the USSR in the nineties. It has a block size of 64 bits.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Secure Remote Password (SRP) cipher suites
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Kerberos cipher suites
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports post quantum algorithms

recommendation.shortName: Post quantum new hope algorihtm support
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports the new hope post quantum algorithm
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports the ECMQV post quantum algorithm
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports stream ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports block ciphers
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports extended master secret extension

resultingRecommendation.shortDescription: Extended master secret extension is not supported
resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Enable support for the extended master secret

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports Encrypt-then-MAC extension
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports token binding

recommendation.shortName: Support for session resumption with session tickets
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports session resumption with session tickets

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Enable session resumption with session tickets

recommendation.shortName: Support for session resumption with session IDs
recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports session resumption with session IDs
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports session resumption with session tickets whose keys are being rotated
recommendation.detailedDescription: Session tickets are created with symmetric keys. The lifetime of the symmetric keys used for session tickets should be restricted to reduce the attack surface. The ticket lifetime is typically indicated in the ticket lifetime hint.

resultingRecommendation.shortDescription: Session resumption with rotating session tickets is disabled
resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Frequently changing session ticket keys improves the security, enable rotated session tickets.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports secure renegotiation extension.
Evaluates whether the TLS server supports client-side secure renegotiation.
recommendation.detailedDescription: TLS secure renegotiation can be started by the client as well as by the server. In its configuration the server can restrict the support for the server-side secure renegotiation. In that case, only the server can start the renegotiation process.

recommendation.shortDescription: Evaluates whether the TLS server supports client-side insecure renegotiation.

resultingRecommendation.handlingRecommendation: Disable renegotiation or enable only secure renegotiation.
